name: Recoleta Classic French-Style 2BDR
description: This classic French-style apartment is located on a quiet, tree-lined street one block away from the Plaza Intendente Alvear and the famous Recoleta Cemetery. Upscale shops, restaurants both grand and intimate, and a walker's paradise are just outside your door.  Recoleta is considered one of the more affluent and safe neighborhoods in BA - historic and filled with architectural gems.  Also a fantastic location to take in the daytime cafe scene or the more lively after dark nightlife.
host_about: I enjoy exploring the far corners of the Earth and getting to know local people and other travelers along the way.  Getting the "local" experience is a lot harder than it sounds, but always worth it.  Food, music, sport, and tradition add to the mix.

name: Gorgeous 2bd in lovely Palermo Soho
description: Welcome to our gorgeous family-owned apartment in the best part of Palermo! A lovely 2 bed apartment than can comfortably hold 6, in a secure, modern building with all amenities. Step outside and you are in BA's best neighbourhood - ready to explore!
neighborhood_overview:
It's a great central location, ideally positioned between Plaza Italia and Plaza Serrano. So you're within easy walking distance of both, but far enough removed to be out of the hustle and bustle.

You're a short walk to parks, the Botanic Gardens, and of course all Palermo Soho's famous boutiques, restaurants, bars and nightlife are on your doorstep.

Local amenities including supermarkets, organic food shops, restaurants/pubs, discos/bars, ice cream parlours, local internet coffee shops, banks and ATM machines are all within a few blocks.

A very short cab ride away are Las Canitas, with its restaurants, bars and polo fields; the Costanera, with its top nightclubs; Aeroparque Jorge Newberry, the domestic airport; Recoleta, with its lovely architecture and stunning cemetery; and San Telmo, with its historical buildings and markets.
host_about:
Originally from England, I moved to Buenos Aires in 2006 after spending 4 years in New York._x000D_
_x000D_
I love travelling, playing sports, meeting people, constantly learning and enjoying life.  So BA has proven to be a good spot to do all that from._x000D_
_x000D_
I live in BA, so am around to answer any questions you might have.

name: Recoleta Apt-Your Home in B. A.!
description: 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom apartment occupying entire floor, on one level, accessed via lift so perfect for those with limited mobility.  In the best neighborhood within walking distant of shops, restaurants, the famous cemetery.
neighborhood_overview:
The architecture of the neighborhood and the people who inhabit this part of the city are fantastic. Plenty of boutiques, restaurants, coffee shops, a great super market, hairdressers, dry cleaner...all conveniently located within steps of our apartment.
To reach the famous cemetery, you turn left out the apartment, walk a few blocks and you're there!

The neighborhood has enough action to feel lively without being too commercial.

Our favorite hangout is Josephina's Cafe, on the corner!
host_about:
Hello!  Recently, my life has been spent heading east and west between the U. S. and Europe, which is why I'm listing our apartment in B. A.  I don't have as much time to head south to Argentina at present!  However, my loss can be your gain!  _x000D_

name: Great 2bd in lovely Palermo Soho
description: Welcome to our great family-owned apartment in the best part of Palermo! A lovely 2 bed apartment than can comfortably hold 6, in a secure, modern building with all amenities. Step outside and you are in BA's best neighbourhood - ready to explore!
neighborhood_overview:
It's a great central location, ideally positioned between Plaza Italia and Plaza Serrano. So you're within easy walking distance of both, but far enough removed to be out of the hustle and bustle. 3 blocks away are all the transport links (subte D and many many bus lines) of Plaza Italia on nearby Santa Fe. You're a short walk to parks, the Botanic Gardens, and of course all Palermo Soho's famous boutiques, restaurants, bars and nightlife are on your doorstep.

Local amenities including supermarkets, organic food shops, restaurants/pubs, discos/bars, ice cream parlours, local internet coffee shops, banks and ATM machines are all within a few blocks.

A very short cab ride away are Las Canitas, with its restaurants, bars and polo fields; the Costanera, with its top nightclubs; Aeroparque Jorge Newberry, the domestic airport; Recoleta, with its lovely architecture and stunning cemetery; and San Telmo, with its historical buildings and markets.
host_about:
Originally from England, I moved to Buenos Aires in 2006 after spending 4 years in New York._x000D_
_x000D_
I love travelling, playing sports, meeting people, constantly learning and enjoying life.  So BA has proven to be a good spot to do all that from._x000D_
_x000D_
I live in BA, so am around to answer any questions you might have.

name: Double Suite with balcony terrace  Sabatico Suites
description:
Sabatico Suites is a new concept, different to a hostel. Thought for travelers or students that are planning to stay longer in the city, looking for a safer and more independent place to live. In Sabatico Suites there is no reception, as the passenger is the one who holds the keys of the house and their rooms.

The room has a queen size bed (or two separate beds). Two bedside tables, a desk with a lamp, wardrobe, air conditioning, central heating and a private bath with a tub are also included.
neighborhood_overview: Sabatico Suites is located in the tradicional neighbourhood of Monserrat, close to the main Subway lines of the city (E.g: 2 blocks away from Line E and 7 from Line C) and 10 blocks to the Congress building. San Telmo is just 5 minutes away and to Microcentro thereâ€™s a 10 minutes walk. Besides, the suites are 6 blocks away from the hostel, making the check in and check out much easier (both take place at the hostel).

Keywords: Apartment, Condominium
host_about:
Born & raised in Buenos Aires, Argentina, from French & Spaniard descendants.     I am well-traveled and outgoing,  and  I LOVE my homes!   I put a lot of care and detail into them,  besides making sure that their "functionality" is perfect.   

I always smile when I tell people that,  "I am the Hostess of the Most-es," as this is what I have done my entire life, both in my personal and professional life.  In simple words, Hosting.  I owned a Salsa & Argentine Tango dance studio for         13 years in Santa Monica.  I like people, working with people, and for people.  

I always prefer guests who will appreciate all the details I put into it,  and also that would care for my place as if it were their own.

I love the sunshine!  I am an energetic, fun, and upbeat business owner. 

My life motto is "passion".

ISabelleSalsa

name: Brand new and luxury in Recoleta
description:
Our fantastic apartment is located in one of the most elegant neighborhoods of Buenos Aires, between Recoleta and Palermo Chico.
The building, TownHouse Coronel Diaz, has been designed by one of the most prestigious architectural firms.
neighborhood_overview:
Palermo Chico is one of the most elegant and safe neighborhoods and just a few minutes walk to the Recoleta Village areas with their restaurants, shopping, nightlife, and other attractions.
Surrounded by plazas, parks and mansions that were traditional families homes and have been transformed into embassies and luxury hotels as well as museums of great cultural and artistic value like the MALBA, the Museum of Decorative Arts or the Museum of Fine Arts.
For those who love walking or biking, is the ideal location for visiting Las Heras Park, the Botanical Garden, the Rosedal Garden, the Palermo Woods, the amazing Plaza Francia with typical craft fair place or its exhibition center and of course the most famous cemetery, La Recoleta.
Or enjoy the best shopping malls in the city such as Alto Palermo, Paseo Alcorta or Patio Bullrich, have a breakfast in the most chic cafes and lunch or dinner in luxurious restaurants.

host_about:
I've been receiving guests since (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and I love doing it. If human relations are important to you, this is the place to stay. You will feel comfortable, at home, free. After staying with me, all my guests said that it was an experience hard to forget as they could enjoy very interesting and sincere  conversations. You will be able to discuss local social and political situation as well as personal matters. I'm a cultured woman, sociologist and writer and I also do carving in wood. I have traveled a lot and am accustomed to deal with cultural differences, something I enjoy a lot. 

I can't live without my family, working, eating good food and drinking good wine, and if I don't travel at least every two years. I've been to Southeast Asia and China, Croatia, Egipt, Turkey, almost all Europe and South and North America. I have just arrived from Ushuaia, the most  austral city in the world. As a traveler, I will be able to advice you concerning your trips inside the country and to neighbour countries.

I'm a TEDx organizer and have given a TED talk last year. To know me better please watch the following: 

 (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

 (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

My enjoyable apartment is located in the most beautiful neighborhood in Buenos Aires, three blocks away from a gorgeous, gigantic park with a lake in it located where you can go running, hiking or walking. Subway, train and more than 20 buses take you everywhere. You will also enjoy buying your groceries at three supermarkets very close to my house. Also there is a small fancy mall with elegant stores and coffee shops one block away. The neighborhood is very secure as there are a lot of embassies. Also, the building has security guards.
I love this spot in Buenos Aires and I can assure you  will love it as much as I do.

This original 3 bedroom apartment is located in the traditional neighborhood of San Telmo. In its beginnings San Telmo was the cradle of the aristocratic families and the rich people, who left the neighborhood due to the Yellow fever in 1871. The big mansions that were abandoned were then occupied by poor European immigrants, creating the â€œconventillosâ€ where the Tango was practiced. Still, San Telmo preserves its style, with narrow cobbled streets and big mansions that were restored to serve as restaurants or tango venues.

The neighborhood of San Telmo is the home of photographers, architects and painters that have their shops in this area. The center is the â€œPlaza Dorregoâ€, surrounded by antique shops that offer every Sunday, during the outdoor fair, hundreds of vendors with arts, crafts and clothing. In the afternoon starts the â€œmilongaâ€, where talented local Tango dancers practice the Tango.

name: vintage apt. with balcony - close to everything
description:
Beautifully fully refurbished high ceiling 1 bedroom spacious vintage apartment with balcony in downtown Buenos Aires. Located on a 6th floor oriented towards northwest so it's very luminous.

Close by to main touristic attractions and means of transport everywhere.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is as downtownish as a residential neighborhood can get in Buenos Aires. It's a very well connected area so you won't have trouble finding any type of transportation at any time. Either by bus or subway, you'll be a 10min-ride away from most attractions in the city.

If you stay away from most touristic restaurants, which you'll recognize right away, I would say it's among the most affordable areas in the city. There are lots of takeaways, supermarkets, pharmacies and any other shop you may need in a walking distance.

The apartment is located a block away from one of Buenos Aires' most iconic avenues and only 7 blocks away from all the pizza places and theaters it's very well known for.
host_about:
I'm originally from Buenos Aires, Argentina, so I can give you hints on anything you may wanna do in the city._x000D_
_x000D_
While I'm living abroad, I rent out my apartment, which hopefully will feel as a home for you as well. :)

name: Amazing BA view from modern 1BR
description: Perfect location in hip Palermo Soho, around the corner from countless restaurants, bars, clubs, plazas (e.g. Serrano), coffee shops and designer clothing stores.  On a major taxi/bus artery, 10 minutes from zoo, Jardin Japones, milongas, etc. Please note this is a non-smoking apartment.
neighborhood_overview: Palermo Viejo or, as more recently renamed, Palermo Soho is an amazing mix of the old and the new of Buenos Aires.  It's very tourist-friendly with a bevy of wonderful restaurants, clubs, bars, international cafes, and fashionable clothing stores, but retains the feel of a liveable Buenos Aires barrio with its local produce stores and bakeries, hardware stores, tranquil plazas and traditional milongas.  Salon Canning is across the road for those looking for some historic tango, and just up the road are the Eco Parque, the Bosques de Palermo, the Japanese Garden and the planetarium.
host_about: We are university professors living in Philly (USA).  We travel often for work, pleasure and/or family.  Richard's favourite book is Catch-22, his favourite movie is Brazil, and he loves a good vindaloo (or chiles en nogada).  Tulia's favorite book is "100 aÃ±os de Soledad", her favorite movie is "Esperando la carroza" and she loves an asado en cruz. Richard's current working motto is "if you want to learn something, try teaching it" (a more positive variation on "those who can't do, teach"). Tulia's favorite mottos are "live and learn" and "mÃ¡s vale tarde que nunca"--but you can't ask why. We love hosting guests in our home-away-from-home in Buenos Aires and sharing the spectacular sunsets and views of the city you can enjoy from our apartment's balcony. We also have a formidable team in Buenos Aires, namely Guillermina, Dora, and Mercedes, who together with us will make sure that you have a comfortable, enjoyable, and rewarding stay in our Buenos Aires apartment.

host_about:
Hola !!! Estoy aqui porque me gusta viajar, conocer lugares, paisajes, actividades, bailar, caminar, pero por sobre toda las cosas me gusta compartir. Conocer otras formas de pensar y vivir, Me gusta reir y descubrir las propuestas de la vida. Estoy  viviendo mis mejores anios pero siento que lo mejor esta por venir_x000D_
He criado mis hijos (a quienes adoro) cuido de mis padres, trabajo, vivo solo pero no en soledad. Intento cada dia tener mas tiempo disponible para viajar y vivir segun mi eleccion. Puedo disfrutar de una ciudad con su vida diurna y nocturana y todos los riesgos que esto implica o de la quietud y el silencio del mar o la montania. Me gusta escuchar el silencio y bailar la musica. Me gusta compartir una charla y tomar un cafe, un vino, una cerveza. En fin me gusta vivir y dejar vivir ..........

name: Palermo 1BR bright+cozy, equipped like home
description: Fully equipped apartment located in the heart of Palermo (1 block from Botanical Garden), one of the liveliest neighborhoods of BsAs: restaurants, coffee  shops, artisans' fair, farmers' market, supermarkets, greengrocers, gyms, laundromats, all within two blockÂ´s distance... Excellent transportation: subway is 3 blocks away, buses are 1 block. Air conditioning is available both in living and bedroom. It has everything you need for short-term or longer-term stays (including washing machine).
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is situated a mere block and a half away from the Botanical Garden (I used to take a walk there in the mornings when I lived there), in an area is full of restaurants and bars, both classic and modern. It is only a few blocks from the enormous, luscious park Bosques de Palermo (for biking, running, golf, boats, free concerts, etc.) as well as from Palermo Viejo with its active nightlife and weekend artisansâ€™ fairs.  There are several supermarkets within two blocks for easy shopping (they all offer home delivery).  Laundromat and pharmacy are in the same block.   You can find several gyms within just a couple of blocks , one with medically supervised, personalized exercise programs is only 4 blocks away. Several renown tango spaces (La Viruta, Salon Canning) are just a short walk away. The apartment has two separate air-conditioning units: one in the living room, and another in the bedroom.
host_about:
Born, raised, and educated in Hungary, I went to the US to get my doctorate, and ended up living in the Boston area for 12 years. After receving my degree, and working there for a couple more years, I moved to Argentina in 2000, where I have been living since. _x000D_
Currently teaching at different local universities and doing research, enjoying what Buenos Aires has to offer.

host_about:
For the last 4 years we traveled the world. We did it with planes, ships, car, motorbikes, campervans, riding bicycles, lodging in family houses, hotels, hostels and even tents. We met more than 40 countries and countless people. Our objective besides geting to know the beauties, was to experience the reality, philosophy and lifestyle of each country, being able to get involved with their culture and customs.
Today from our hometown, Buenos Aires, we want to continue traveling through the people doing what passionate us: cultural exchange and travel experiences.
Welcome to Argentina!
Learn more about us in our blog for cultural and independent travelers: www.somosgolondrinos.com or in Facebook https://www.facebook.com/pg/face.golondrinos
We enjoy being both, guest and host.
When we are guests we want to learn the cultures to adopt different thoughts and manners. We love history, culture, traditional food and different life philosophy beyond the touristic and common path. When we are hosts, we enjoy cooking and shareing traditional argentinian dishes, taking our guests to nice places, meet our friends and introduce them. We also enjoy being tourists in our hometown along with them.

neighborhood_overview:
Recoleta is Buenos Airesâ€™ most desired, safe, elegant and architecturally significant neighborhood, surrounded by parks, cafes, restaurants, and shopping. It is centrally located between historical San Telmo and up and coming Palermo. The famous Recoleta cemetary and Recoleta Mall is located 4 blocks away. Shopping on Santa Fe Avenue is just 1 1/2 blocks from our building.
There are several cafes and restaurants within one block of the building. There is a very nice and large grocery store one block away.
Recoleta is approximately 45 minutes from the international airport (EZE) and 15 minutes from the domestic airport (AEP). We are happy to provide transportation to & from both airports.

neighborhood_overview:
Palermo is currently the neighborhood chosen by most tourists, foreign students and travelers from all over the world, many have even stayed to live here, it is very common to hear spoken in other languages on the street.
There is a lot of cultural movement, the avant-garde of fashion, bars, discos, restaurants, cafes everywhere. The good thing is that at the same time it is still a neighborhood with many of its cobbled streets, narrow passages reminiscent of other times, with its people, its warehouses, greengrocers, guild workshops, kiosks, all mixed like a cultural salad, to me it seems very attractive, I hope to you too :) !
It is very PorteÃ±os stop at any time of the day to have a coffee, or a "cortado" (coffee with a milk corrito) in a bar, there is one in every corner! and read the newspaper, or watch the football game on the "TV" of the bar with friends!

name: VIVA SAN TELMO
description: A lovely apartment in the heart of San Telmo, one block from Plaza Dorrego, home of the Antique Fair and the best outdoor cafes. It is very close to the traditional San Telmo Market with its many dining venues, and just one block from the Metrobus del Bajo.
neighborhood_overview: San Telmo is the oldest quarter in town. You can walk across cobblestone streets and enjoy looking at colorful Santa Ritas, drink a delicious coffee or a cold beer at the cafÃ©s on Plaza Dorrego, go to the near Puerto Madero or La Boca, fill your eyes with the power of nature at the Reserva Natural de Buenos Aires. San Telmo has a unique personality that makes it different from any other quarter in Buenos Aires: it is full of history, color, experiences, and the distinct sounds of tango and candombe.

neighborhood_overview:
Recoleta is a downtown residential neighborhood in the Autonomous city of Buenos Aires, Argentina. It is an area of great historical and architectural interest.

Together with some sections of the neighboring communities of Retiro and Palermo, Recoleta forms a part of the area known as Barrio Norte, Buenos Aires, a traditional residential zone for the city's most affluent families, where a great portion of the cultural life of the city is concentrated.

The Recoleta neighborhood is home to most of the famous art museums and loveliest parks in Buenos Aires.

name: Palermo Loft
description: Sip your morning coffee on the balcony in the hip Palermo Nuevo district of Buenos Aires or just head downstairs to the corner coffeeshop for medialunas y cafe cortado.  The Palermo Loft is an ideal base and a peaceful retreat in the busy and bustling city of Buenos Aires.  Excellent location with easy access to the whole city.  Itâ€™s a short walk to the metro, the rose garden, the bus terminal station and the Palermo parks.
neighborhood_overview:
Palermo is one of the largest neighborhoods in Buenos Aires, and is known for being the green lung of Buenos Aires, with gardens comparable to those of the High Park of London. Palermo Loft is located blocks from these gardens, in a safe and relatively quiet neighborhood, away from most traffic and city noise.

In close walking distance, you also have access to countless bars and restaurants, as well as many city highlights, including Las CaÃ±itas, La Rural Convention Center (Tango World Championship), the horse track, Palermo Soho, and Palermo Hollywood.

There is also a brand new outlet mall with tons of hip stores within walking distance, on Santa Fe and Godoy Cruz.

Eat dinner in historic La Catedral by the horse race track, where Tango rockstar, Carlos Gardel was inspired to write Por una Cabeza. Take a tango class at the famous La Viruta and dance your heart out until the wee hours of the night. In the morning, grab a traditional Argentine medialuna

neighborhood_overview:
Palermo is the largest neighborhood in Buenos Aires. It is located in the northeast of the city, bordering the "barrios" of Belgrano to the north, Almagro and Recoleta to the south, Villa Crespo and Colegiales to the west and the RÃ­o de la Plata river to the east.

Although appearing as one big swath on the official map, Palermo can be subdivided into several contrasting and acutely individual parts: Palermo Viejo, Palermo Soho, Palermo Hollywood, Palermo Chico, CaÃ±itas and Alto Paermo.

Specialy Palermo Soho, CaÃ±itas and Palermo Hollywood have become the newly fashionable area of Bs As for fashion, design, restaurants, bars and street culture. The atmosphere in many cafÃ©s and restaurants strives to be "alternative", which makes this area of the city especially popular with young, upper-middle class Argentines as well as foreign tourists. The traditional low houses have been adapted into boutiques and bars, creating a bohemian feel. Come and enjoy!!!

IN T

Just 40 meters away, the lush Lezama Park invites you to explore one of the city's largest green reserves. The charm continues on the elegant Avenida Boulevard Caseros, where you will enjoy an exquisite gastronomic polo.

Our carefully restored historic building captures the essence of the era, immersing you in the rich culture of tango and milonga. The streets are full of life, with music overflowing and dancing on their sidewalks. You'll also discover organic boutiques with traditional and international delights. Prepare to immerse yourself in the authenticity and diversity of San Telmo!

neighborhood_overview:
PALERMO is a neighborhood that is fundamentally residential and recreational. Much of its extension is occupied by the so-called Palermo Forests, which include a sum of several parks and green spaces. With more than 80 hectares, it is one of the largest green spaces in Buenos Aires. The city's locals visit for picnics or sports.

A part of the sprawling neighborhood of Palermo has been transformed into the most active gastronomic hub of the City of Buenos Aires. What is today called Palermo Hollywood, delimited by Av.Juan B. Justo, Dorrego, Av.Santa Fe and Av.CÃ³rdoba, for decades was reserved almost exclusively for middle-class family residences and car repair workshops. But after the arrival in the neighborhood, at the beginning of the current century, of producers and TV channels with their respective pos Producers, he received the name that he currently has. Along with the landing of the first artistic companies, a new phenomenon, the gastronomic began to develop.

It is a strategic location for travelers who come to Buenos Aires to dance tango and who wish visit several milongas in a single night, as the locals do.

description: Our bright, beautiful, and spacious 3 bedroom room apartment is tastefully decorated and well equipped to make you feel at home. neighborhood_overview:
The appartment is located in a lovely neighbourhood. One can have some mate on the balcony or walk to one of the several coffee shops on the sorroundings like Farinelli, or Coffee Shelter, as well as to the excellent restaurants to have lunch or dinner. We recommend la FlorerÃ­a AtlÃ¡ntico, around the corner, which is a very famous speakeasy bar in Buenos Aires or BASA, a couple of blocks away.
Arroyo Street is around the corner too, which is one of the most beautiful streets in Buenos Aires, where you may find landmark building, Estrugamou Building.
It is also close to Plaza San MartÃ­n and other attractions like Palacio Anchorena and the beautiful Hispano-american art museum, Alvear Street is very close too.
For grocery shopping you can find a small supermarket (Carrefour Express) right around the corner and a bigger one (Disco) only a few steps further.

Ideal for a couple or a single person seeking privacy and independence at an affordable price, and to take advantage of the cultural life of the city . It is close Universities and most important theaters, milonga, traditional restaurants, etc.

neighborhood_overview:
"Once" is geographically in the center of the city, where almost all the transport lines converge.
It is the most heterogeneous neighborhood in all of Buenos Aires, it has a unique mix of nationalities and cultures that, among other things, decant into an impressive offer of business, dining options and entertainment. It was always characterized by having different communities of immigrants and was characterized by the activity of the Jewish community and its link with the textile market, which in turn attracted Arab and Armenian communities. A few blocks away is the market area El Abasto historically had a mixture of Creoles and Italians, where most of the milongas and the tango move were located. Currently, most of the Peruvian community has also settled offering a great gastronomic offer.

It is a very commercial point, by day there is a lot of movement in the street. It is recommended to pay attention to personal objects.

The great advantage is that in the

On Avenida Cabildo are the stations of the subway (line D) and transit numerous bus lines. Manuel Belgrano Square: it is the center of the neighborhood. description: Impeccable brand new apartment with amenities  (terrace with barbecue and laundry) in the heart of Villa Crespo / Palermo. Close to Movistar Arena. neighborhood_overview:
Villa Crespo reinvented itself without losing its identity. It is a booming cultural and gastronomic pole with an immense range of bars, theatres, and restaurants that satisfy even the most exquisite palates.

For many Villa Crespo is synonymous with bohemian, poets, old tangos, picturesque cafes, old guard orchestral redoubts: and they're right. But there is another Villa Crespo, today's, the cosmopolitan and commercial, which does not lose sight of the future, but does not forget the tradition, oscillating, always, between tradition and myth.

description:

The room has a warm decoration and 2 comfortable single beds, wardrobe, storage places and table for breakfast.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood of San Telmo is the historic neighborhood of the city of Buenos Aires, tango neighborhood,and has excellent connection to the whole city by a bus system just 100 meters from the house by the Metrobus del Bajo.
Underground of the city 600 meters away.
We are in the historic area, a place very visited daily by thousands of tourists, and you can find museums, bars, resturants and milongas.
There are shops and supermarkets.

Hola mi nombre es Juan. Soy argentino, tengo 33 aÃ±os, y llevo 5 viviendo en Ciudad de Buenos Aires, siempre compartiendo el departamento. neighborhood_overview:
El Bajo Belgrano is a historic neighborhood in Buenos Aires city, which in the last few years has had great growth with new restaurants and bars, and modern real estate developments that combine with the classic neighborhood houses of Buenos Aires.

The neighborhood is always on the go, and it's one of those places worth visiting anytime. Today, its contrast of proposals ranges from deco venues and showrooms tucked between cobblestone streets and traditional museums to the new train station or renovated Monroe Avenue and surroundings, which positioned itself as the climbing gastronomic pole of the area.

On Avenida Libertador (one block from the house) there are banks, exchange houses, pharmacies, shops. The Chinatown is just 500 meters away, a place for shopping, walking and getting to know how Chinese and Argentine culture gather in one place.

description: Located in the heart of Avda 9 de Julio a few steps from tourist attractions such as the Obelisk of Buenos Aires, Plaza de Mayo, Casa Rosada, Teatro ColÃ³n and Florida Street.
neighborhood_overview: Buenos Aires, the capital and largest city in Argentina, is a vibrant and energetic place. With its unique blend of European architecture and Latin American spirit, Buenos Aires offers a fascinating mix of cultural traditions and modernity. The city is famous for its passion for tango, and you can find milongas and tango shows around every corner. In addition, Buenos Aires is home to an incredible food scene, with restaurants serving delicious barbecues and international cuisine. The neighborhoods of La Boca and San Telmo are known for their bohemian charm and cobblestone streets. The iconic Obelisk on 9th Avenue is a distinctive symbol of the city, while the Teatro ColÃ³n is one of the most important opera houses in the world. Buenos Aires is also home to numerous museums, including the National Museum of Fine Arts and MALBA, home to valuable art collections. In short, Buenos Aires is a city that captivates its energy, culture, and unique lifestyle.

name: Modern Apartment in Quartier San Telmo
description:
*Incomparable apartment in "TORRE QUARTIER SAN TELMO" with unbeatable amenities, especially for discerning guests where the details are very important.
*The building has the best state-of-the-art services and amenities, ideal for a unique stay.
*It has 24-hour security, heated pool (enabled from December to April), solarium, parks, gym, viewpoint on the 27th floor where you can admire the view of our beautiful city.
neighborhood_overview:
*San Telmo is one of the oldest and most traditional neighborhoods of our city, where the history of the city and the Argentine Republic took place.
*It is a beautiful bohemian neighborhood, ideal for walking. It has been upgraded and modernized in recent years.
*It is made up of the beautiful Plaza Dorrego, which is the oldest, then Plaza de Mayo. Every Sunday, this plaza becomes the fiesta of San Telmo, where there are beautiful artisans, antiques (flea market) and tango dances.
*I always recommend visiting the old art galleries, which this beautiful neighborhood has to offer.
* 15 blocks away is the unbeatable JUNIORS MOUTH Stadium, and 5 blocks away is CAMINITO, a must-see for those visiting the neighborhood.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is safe and quiet. Palermo is ideal to know Buenos Aires. Half block from Calle Honduras and one from Coronel Diaz. Both tree-lined avenues, with a lot of vegetation and the amount of bars to enjoy the sunny days. One block away there is a large hypermarket where you can buy what you need and right in front, a convenience store for the most urgent needs. The historic Barrio de Montserrat, the oldest in the city is close to La Plaza de Mayo, surrounded by iconic buildings such as the presidential palace, La Casa Rosada and the Colonial Style Cabildo Museum. Manzana de las Luces, a former Jesuit complex, is now a cultural center. The Metropolitan Cathedral and Iglesias Monserrat, San Ignacio, San Francisco and Nuestra SeÃ±ora del Rosario. Within the eclectic landmarks of Avenida de Mayo include the Palacio Barolo, a neo-Gothic skyscraper, and the CafÃ© Tortoni, a famous cafe from the 1850s.
In this beautiful neighborhood the history of the city converge with the modernity of spaces such as Puerto Madero , with the famous Puente de La Mujer, El Paseo del Bajo and Bars and Restaurants .

neighborhood_overview:
You have many coffees and restaurants around the area.
The area is surrounded by walking distance parks, of which one is the well known botanic garden, the Japanese Garden and the Bosques de Palermo (Palermo woods), designed by Carlos Thays, this park was inspired by London's Hyde Park and is recognized as the most vast and open green area of Buenos Aires. Inaugurated in the early 1900â€™s, you can also find El Rosedal (Rose Garden), with more than 1000 rose species from around the world, blooming between September and March. Outdoor activities abound surrounding the area, from music concerts to pedal boat rentals over the lake.
Malba Museum is 7 min. walk from the apartment.

name: HERMOSO DEPARTAMENTO EN EL CORAZON DE RECOLETA
description:
Relax in this quiet space in the most elegant and luxurious area of Buenos Aires.
Recoleta is known for its French-style architecture, upscale shops, and famous cemetery.
The apartment has a bedroom with a queen size bed and a living/dining room with kitchen integrated with a double sofa bed.
We accept pets.
neighborhood_overview: Recoleta is a thriving area, known for its Paris-style townhouses, opulent former palaces and luxury boutiques. The Recoleta Cemetery is one of the main attractions, as it houses the extravagant tombs of national icons such as Eva PerÃ³n. In the National Museum of Fine Arts, masterpieces are exhibited, while in the Recoleta Cultural Center, avant-garde temporary events are offered. In the lawn-covered Plaza Francia, a handicraft market is held on weekends.

High End Building with great amenities like an astonished swimming pool in 17th floor rooftop to rest and calm (open all the year long in spite not being warm); Gym 16th Floor ultra light; Sauna; Laundry and 24 hs Security Doorman.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the trendy Palermo Hollywood neighborhood on probably the best street - Humboldt. This cool area has a number of radio and TV studios, and is where all the best new restaurants and bars are opening in the city. Of course Palermo Soho is just a few blocks away - so consider yourself in the middle of one big happening Palermo neighborhood.
Wide range of first-class restaurants a few steps from the department such as Sushi "Osaka" (200 meters); Japanese "M"; Thai "Sudestada" and traditional grills from Argentina such as "Don Julio" (700 mts); "La Cabrera" 1000 mts and "La CarnicerÃ­a" 500 mts. Also a few blocks away are the award-winning restaurants such as "La Mar" of Peruvian food (8 blocks); gourmet coffee such as "Cuervo" and "Lattente"; Amazing burgers like "Williamsburg" and "Burger Co."
In addition, the location allows you to be a few blocks from the "Bosques de Palermo" to enjoy outdoor activities.

neighborhood_overview:
Palermo is the largest neighborhood in Buenos Aires. It is located in the northeast of the city, bordering the "barrios" of Belgrano to the north, Almagro and Recoleta to the south, Villa Crespo and Colegiales to the west and the RÃ­o de la Plata river to the east.

Although appearing as one big swath on the official map, Palermo can be subdivided into several contrasting and acutely individual parts: Palermo Viejo, Palermo Soho, Palermo Hollywood, Palermo Chico, CaÃ±itas and Alto Paermo.

Specialy Palermo Soho, CaÃ±itas and Palermo Hollywood have become the newly fashionable area of Bs As for fashion, design, restaurants, bars and street culture. The atmosphere in many cafÃ©s and restaurants strives to be "alternative", which makes this area of the city especially popular with young, upper-middle class Argentines as well as foreign tourists. The traditional low houses have been adapted into boutiques and bars, creating a bohemian feel. Come and enjoy!!!

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located at the border between Palermo and Belgrano. The location is ideal since it has all the means of transport nearby that take you everywhere in the city. Just a few meters away, you have countless restaurants, cafes and bars to avoid walking away for a good breakfast or a rich dinner. Within a 200-meter radius you have pharmacies, supermarkets, hardware stores, bakeries, greengrocers. Everything is within reach just a few steps away. If you want natural spaces, have the forests of Palermo within a 15-minute walk and the rosedal is a half hour walk away.

IMPORTANT detail to keep in mind, the apartment is located on Avenida Cabildo. It is an avenue that is busy by many public transports. While the apartment is located on a 13th floor, it can be a bit noisy.

neighborhood_overview: Recoleta is an unmissable neighborhood of Buenos Aires and from the apartment just 1 block away you will find the historic Recoleta Cemetery. Across to Pueyrredon Avenue, you can enjoy a beautiful walk along the Isle of Puppet, with beautiful European reminders, finding yourself with the residence of the British Embassy and the National Library. Down the ravine towards Avenida Libertador you will reach the Museo de Bellas Artes and Plaza Francia with its beautiful craft fair being able to visit the Cultural Center,  and you can walk streets with bars and restaurants, including the La Biela bar in a beautiful setting imbued with the poetry of Buenos Aires. name: Charming 2 bedroom on top floor of amazing house!
description:
Spend a pleasant stay in this atypical house, full of charm in a booming and creative neighborhood, surrounded by native plants that welcome butterflies at a certain time of year, a vineyard
centenary that comes to offer you grapes at your window, and a pool that refreshes you in spring summer!
The neighborhood is dynamic and quiet with all transportation within email reach!
neighborhood_overview: Chacarita is a neighborhood that is booming, more and more bobo. Very lively and nice and thankfully still very residential. Alternative neighborhood where prod boxes, organic store, cool bookstores and other small shops have been settled. Very colorful, wooded with lots of young little restaurants. This neighborhood is growing fast.
host_about:
We are a French and Argentine couple who love sharing the best of our city and meeting travelers from all over the world. 
We transformed the house into a guest house to welcome fellow travelers, coming for work or leisure, and seeking a friendly, comfortable oasis in an authentic booming and Bohemian Buenos Aires neighborhood.   _x000D_
We are a mix of music-therapist, yogis, writers, cooks and travelers. _x000D_
We speak Spanish, French, English, and Portuguese and look forward to sharing with you our favorite restaurants, shops, museums, and cultural events in Buenos Aires. _x000D_
_x000D_
 More specificly about us:_x000D_
Jorge is passionate about music instruments from all over the world, he gathered what looks like the Cave of Ali-Baba of music instruments.  He is also passionate about native plants and transformed the house into an oasis of greens that attract butterflies. _x000D_
Fann is a yoga teacher, loves art, decoration, anything to do with colours and crafts or music.

neighborhood_overview:
Belgrano

One of the most residential and picturesque neighborhoods in the city, with historic stately homes from the 19th century that coexist with modern and sophisticated buildings.
An environment with wide commercial, gastronomic and educational offerings, it is located in the north of the city and its residential tradition fuses luxury houses and modern apartment buildings.
Avenida Cabildo is a large shopping center that has its epicenter at its intersection with Juramento Street.
It has a lot of transportation lines and the Metrobus that continues into the province. Belgrano C and Belgrano R train stations provide accessibility as well as the D line of the Underground.
The so-called "Chinatown", on the streets of ArribeÃ±os and MontaÃ±eses, between Juramento and Monroe, is a cultural walk that includes various specialty supermarkets, locals with imported products and restaurants.
The green lung is provided by the magnificent park of the Barra

Quiet and comfortable, two bedroom apt in Recoleta neighborhood in a dreamy historic building.

Walking distance from the famous Recoleta cemetery, Recoleta shopping center, subway station, super-markets, grocery stores, cafes, Biblioteca Nacional, among other attractions.

50 mts walk through private gardens, 1 floor walk up by stairs, 2 bedrooms, 1 queen bed + 2 twin beds, 1 bathroom (shower) and 1 toilette.

Live a full experience in this area of town!

description:
This space is a beautiful and comfortable 41 meter apartment.
Its a vintage building, with high ceilings and large windows. It should be noted that it is very well maintained and has an elevator as well as a stairs.

neighborhood_overview:
Retiro is one of the busiest neighborhoods in the Capital of Buenos Aires. It stands out for its bars and offices. During the day it is very busy, since there are many workers in the area. At night it is quieter but it has a great nightlife due to the number of gastronomic offers it has.
Retiro is very well connected with the other neighborhoods of the capital. It is easily accessible via bus, subway, train or car.

neighborhood_overview:
The Barrio de San Telmo boasts temporary art galleries, night bars and incredible street murals give old San Telmo a bohemian feel. Packed with antiquaries and rustic meat restaurants, Calle Defense crosses Plaza Dorrego, which houses a flea market and street artists that attract tourists every Sunday. The neighborhood has many establishments that offer dinners with tango shows.

In Lezama Park there are trails that wind around tall jacaranda trees and the Italian National Historical Museum. Beautiful place to go for a walk and enjoy.

A few blocks away is the LA MOUTH neighborhood that has several restaurants specializing in meats and street performers with tango shows surrounding Caminito, the famous narrow alley flanked by brightly painted zinc houses that evoke the early days of immigrants. neighborhood_overview:
Palermo Soho is a favorite neighborhood for those who visit Buenos Aires and choose it for its tranquility and for the number of activities to do. The neighborhood has the characteristic of being transformed depending on the days of the week. It is usually very different from the mornings where everything is tranquility.

Coming to shop in Palermo Soho is common. You'll find from decorating houses, craft fairs, signature clothes, and to renowned brand venues. All in one place.

Armenia's Immigrant Square is Palermo Soho's largest square. It has a space with games and activities for children, a craft fair, lots of green and is the neighbors' favorite space to spend time with their pets. On Saturday mornings, next to the square, there is a fruit and vegetable market that locals and tourists come to looking for good prices.

name: Amplio Dpto en Caballito - Ideal Parejas/ Familias
description:
Spacious, bright and quiet apartment, surrounded by a wide gastronomic and commercial offer (shops, supermarkets, etc).
On a 5 minutes walk you can discover "Patio de los Lecheros", a gastronomic center. Minutes away you can visit Plaza Irlanda to have a picnic enjoying the sun, and just a few minutes from subway A and several bus lines to move around the city.
The lodging has a comfortable King Size mattress, sheets and towels, laundry, cookware and a sunny balcony for an outdoor breakfast.
neighborhood_overview:
Caballito is one of the most important and traditional neighborhoods in Buenos Aires. Today, it stands out as a highly sought-after neighborhood in residential and commercial terms. A family spirit place, but also where the growth of local businesses is promoted.
It is located in the geographical center of the city, which means a privileged position. Whether it is for transportation to or from other neighborhoods, or for being a nucleus that connects different areas, being the center facilitates its development.

host_about:
Mi nombre es Giseli, soy psicÃ³loga, naturalista y madre de 2 hermosos niÃ±os.
Me encanta viajar, cocinar, leer y sacar fotos. Me gusta la aventura, viajar es una pasiÃ³n, conocer lugares y sabores nuevos. Viajar a todo tipo de destinos, recorrer ciudades, conocer su historia y las distintas culturas. Para vacaciones siempre elegimos la playa. Buscamos tranquilidad, soledad, contacto con la naturaleza, lo mÃ¡s agreste posible y las mejores olas. 
Como familia llevamos un estilo de vida sustentable, separamos nuestros residuos, cocinamos nuestra comida, cuidamos de nuestra huerta y evitamos todo consumo innecesario. Disfrutamos del confort siempre y cuando se respete la ecologÃ­a. Cuidamos el agua y nos encargamos de no malgastar este valioso recurso. 
Sumamente respetuosos de las demÃ¡s personas y su ambiente, cuidamos los lugares a donde vamos tanto como cuidamos nuestro hogar.
Respetamos y amamos a todos los animales y plantas, sabemos que el mundo no es Ãºnicamente de las personas y que nuestra Tierra es nuestra real y Ãºnica casa.

neighborhood_overview:
The Barrio de San Telmo boasts temporary art galleries, night bars and incredible street murals give old San Telmo a bohemian feel. Packed with antiquaries and rustic meat restaurants, Calle Defense crosses Plaza Dorrego, which houses a flea market and street artists that attract tourists every Sunday. The neighborhood has many establishments that offer dinners with tango shows.

In Lezama Park there are trails that wind around tall jacaranda trees and the Italian National Historical Museum. Beautiful place to go for a walk and enjoy.

A few blocks away is the LA MOUTH neighborhood that has several restaurants specializing in meats and street performers with tango shows surrounding Caminito, the famous narrow alley flanked by brightly painted zinc houses that evoke the early days of immigrants. Here is also La Bombonera, which vibrates on match days. It is home to the Boca Juniors football team. You can also find the Proa Foundation Museum of Modern Art which has te

name: Casa estilo PH con sala de Yoga en Chacarita
description:
We like to call this house by its street name; "Guevara."
Guevara is a house that has the beautiful peculiarity of having a room where we practice and give Yoga classes. Where we share a lifestyle that values â€‹â€‹harmony, tranquility and the enjoyment of encounter in sharing. Furthermore, this space, located in a key area of â€‹â€‹CABA, invites you to find a part of the city of Buenos Aires where you can enjoy the beautiful diversity of people.
neighborhood_overview:
Chacarita is one of the most booming federal capital neighborhoods in recent times!!
*It has a variety of gastronomic offerings.
* Distinctive bars that make the area authentic and where you are within reach of interesting experiences: there are options for all styles of people and tastes.
*Buenos Aires was always very plentiful in its cultural offerings. Chacarita today for today is a super recommended point in the city to attend the theater to watch an original staging, dance theater, performance theater, live music, etc.
*During the day you can stroll through the picturesque neighborhood streets, you will find lots of places to sit and enjoy a rich coffee :)
*If you prefer the green of the trees; just two blocks from the accommodation you will be able to tour the great Parque de Los Andes or walk towards the fruit port and get to know the Mafalda square, among other beautiful options.

neighborhood_overview:
With this denomination this area of Buenos Aires has been recognized since the beginning of the 18th century. Its name comes from the Casa del Retiro, built at the beginning of this century at the intersection of the current Arenales and MaipÃº by the governor AgustÃ­n de Robles, very close to the hermitage of San SebastiÃ¡n, there existing already in 1608. Shortly afterwards the house was sold to the South Sea company, and was intended to house the slaves who had arrived in Buenos Aires.

In 1800 construction work began on Plaza de Toros, whose contour is still maintained in Plaza San MartÃ­n, on Avenida Santa Fe. During the English invasions a memorable confrontation took place in it, following which the place received the name of Field of Glory. There the grenadiers under General JosÃ© de San MartÃ­n also received instruction, and the place began to have importance because of the barracks that moved the bullring. From this, the site was renamed the Field of Mars.

On J

neighborhood_overview:
Recoleta is a central residential neighborhood of Buenos Aires that has a great historical and architectural interest. It differs from the other neighborhoods of Buenos Aires by the quality of its architecture and the aristocratic character of its residences, surrounded by splendid gardens and squares.

Recoleta is the most elegant neighborhood in the city for its buildings, its commercial area and its famous cemetery. When don Juan de Garay founded the city of Buenos Aires in 1580, he distributed land among the members of his expedition. The sector comprised by the current neighborhood of Recoleta was granted to Rodrigo Ortiz de ZÃ¡rate.

The name of this Buenos Aires neighborhood derives from the Convent and Church of the Recollect friars who arrived here at the beginning of the 18th century. description:
Enjoy your stay in Buenos Aires in a relaxed and quiet environment, for a very affordable price!
The house is located in the historic San Telmo neighborhood, in downtown Buenos Aires, steps from Puerto Madero, and in an excellent and safe location, with buses to the entire city just 100 meters away.
The room is small , 2.00m x 2.00, but it is quiet, for a single person and with a very affordable price.

neighborhood_overview:
San Telmo is the historic neighborhood of the city of Buenos Aires, with multiple tourist attractions, and great gastronomic offerings with bars and restaurants, concentrated in the old San Telmo Market, just 100 meters from the house.
The neighborhood's cobblestone streets are reminiscent of tango times, and on Sundays the famous San Telmo fair is held along Calle Defesa at the door of the house!
Bohemian neighborhood, with museums , historical places, and antique shops that characterize the neighborhood.
The location is excellent near the city center, walking 700 meters from the Plaza de Mayo, 400 meters away from Pueto Madero and walking a little more we find the Ecological Reserve of the city, overlooking native animals and plants, to walk its trails next to the Rio de la Plata a little more walking.
The accommodation is 100 meters from the Metrobus del Bajo, where we find almost all the city buses.
And very close to several subway lines.

Molina city is located in a historic building in the city of Buenos Aires.

Very close to the Barrio de La Boca, San Telmo, Puerto Madero and the main accesses to the city.

The Barrio de San Telmo boasts temporary art galleries, night bars and incredible street murals give old San Telmo a bohemian feel. Packed with antique dealers and rustic meat restaurants, Defense Street runs through Dorrego Square, home to a flea market and street performers who attract tourists every Sunday. The neighborhood has many establishments that offer dinners with tango shows.

In Lezama Park there are trails that wind around tall jacaranda trees and the Italian National Historical Museum. Beautiful place to go for a walk and enjoy.

The new businesses blend in with the area's historic chorizo type houses that give it a comparable charm - for many - to many - to the Le Marais neighborhood of Paris, one of the oldest neighborhoods located on the right bank of the Seine, which is characterized by its colorful and cultural offer. neighborhood_overview:
San Telmo is one of the oldest and most emblematic neighborhoods of the city. It still retains much of its original architecture, with historic mansions, cobbled streets and courtyards with fountains. Explore several converted mansions, such as the "Defense Passage", which was once the private home of the Ezeiza family, look for unique items in the numerous antique shops, attend a tango show or have a coffee in a traditional bar (we recommend "British").
The neighborhood has gained a bohemian air thanks to the many artists and musicians in the area, and has a growing food scene with new restaurants and craft breweries.
In the heat of San Telmo is Plaza Dorrego, an old square surrounded by bars. Here the city's largest antique fair takes place on Sundays, along with the hugely popular market on Defensa Street (just 1 block from the La Galerie building), where you can find everything from antiques to contemporary handicrafts.
You are just 1 block from the foodie area of Av

neighborhood_overview:
Palermo is a very extensive residential neighborhood, located in a privileged area of the City of Buenos Aires. It's the largest neighborhood in town. It stands out in particular for its beautiful avenues populated with trees, for its elegant houses, its many cultural spaces and bars, as well as beautiful and spacious parks to enjoy the day and outdoor activities. It's one of the greenest areas in the City of Buenos Aires, notably in Parque Tres de Febrero, popularly known as â€œthe forests of Palermoâ€.

Palermo is a nice area to go out to eat or go to parties. It is ideal especially for young people and students, although people of all ages can enjoy it extensively. It's a perfect place to shop. In addition, it has specific attractions such as the Botanical Garden, the Japanese Garden and the ecological park.

name: Casa di Sophia
description: Welcome to Casa di Sophia, our apartment in the heart of Buenos Aires. We are a few meters from San Juan and Boedo, the corner of Tango. You will have everything you need nearby (restaurants, bars and shops), as well as means of transport to visit iconic places in the city. It is ideal for a couple or student, since the apartment is fully equipped: kitchen, double bed, sofa, large storage space and up to a workstation. We look forward to seeing you soon!
neighborhood_overview:
Casa di Sophia is located in the heart of Boedo. It is a quiet neighborhood, with a tradition of tango and PorteÃ±o carnival. In recent years, the neighborhood has earned a lot of footprints since the opening of several restaurants and bars with home delivery or to eat there. Boedo is also home to classic bars like CafÃ© Margot, the corner of Homero Manzi, and the Trianon. On the main avenues (San Juan, Boedo, Independencia), there are a variety of supermarkets, pharmacies, ice cream parlors, bakeries and other places of various services.

neighborhood_overview:
Retiro is one of the largest hubs of transportation services in Argentina, and is home to many high-end stores and residential areas popular among both local wealthy gentry and expatriate executives. Local and long distance rail service heading to the north originate from EstaciÃ³n Retiro, also a major long-distance bus terminal is located adjacent to the station, subte line C of the Buenos Aires Metro system and numerous local public bus services, this area is always teeming with commuters and traffic on weekdays.
A major thoroughfare is Avenida del Libertador, which becomes Avenida Leandro N. Alem past the Retiro train terminal. Avenida Leandro Alem runs north-to-south along the Buenos Aires Central Business District, the Retiro section of the business district is centered on the Catalinas Norte office park, initially built in the 1970s over docklands developed a century earlier by Francisco Seeber. Other principal streets and avenues in Retiro are Santa Fe, CÃ³rdoba, and Libertad
host_about:
Hello. Im Francisco _x000D_
I am a Lawyer and Realtor, but nowadays I am involved in many other things, such as property maintenance and development, Agro, and taking holidays myself in Airbnb properties elsewhere._x000D_
I live out in the country 2 hours from Buenos Aires, surrounded by the Pampas, nature and horses. _x000D_
As a City of Buenos Aires guide myself, I have a passion about the warp and weft of my town and relish the chance to share this enthusiasm with my guests._x000D_
I'm fond of books and the flat in Buenos Aires is well- filled with them. _x000D_
I enjoy traveling especially to Uruguay, music, art and the cultural opportunities presented by their design. I also winter in Patagonia where I go Skiing, sport I love.  _x000D_
My properties are always ready for visitors. I like to keep it clean and uncluttered, such as you would expect in a good hotel â€“ it is home I like to share with you if you stay. I can't always be there but I will make sure everything goes smoothly. _x000D_
The motto -Carpe Diemâ€“ Seize the moment while you can_x000D_
Drives my life !

name: Luxurious Apt. in Puerto Madero
description: Experience luxury in the heart of Buenos Aires! This stunning apartment, located in the city's most prestigious neighborhood, boasts brand new and modern furnishings to ensure a comfortable and lavish stay. From its chic decor to its prime location, you'll be surrounded by the best that Buenos Aires has to offer. Savor the delights of local cuisine, catch a glimpse of the city's rich cultural heritage, or simply relax and unwind in the comfort of your own spacious and stylish living quarters.
neighborhood_overview: Puerto Madero is a vibrant neighborhood in Buenos Aires, Argentina known for its modern architecture, upscale dining, and scenic waterfront. As a guest in this neighborhood, you'll have access to some of the city's top restaurants, ranging from traditional Argentine steak houses to fusion cuisine. In addition, top attractions such as the Ecological Reserve and the Women's Bridge are just a short walk away, offering breathtaking views of the city and the Rio de la Plata. Whether you're in town for business or pleasure, Puerto Madero is the perfect base for your stay in Buenos Aires.

neighborhood_overview:
San CristÃ³bal is one of the forty-eight neighborhoods of the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires, capital of the Argentine Republic. Subway lines E and H run through it. Located in the east area of the city, very close to the old town and part of the current neighborhood is within the area demarcated by the founder Juan de Garay as city limits.

It has an area of 2.1 kmÂ² and a population of 48,611 inhabitants (Indec, 2010). The San Cristobal neighborhood is bordered by Independencia avenues, Entre Rios, Juan de Garay and Calle SÃ¡nchez de Loria. It borders the neighborhoods of Balvanera to the north, Constitution to the east, Parque Patricios to the south, and Boedo to the west. San CristÃ³bal is a neighborhood with few green spaces.

neighborhood_overview:
Palermo Chico, also known as Barrio Parque, is one of the most exclusive and elegant neighborhoods in Buenos Aires, Argentina. Located in the southeast of the vast area of Palermo, this small residential enclave is known for its quiet atmosphere, tree-lined streets, and distinctive architecture.

The neighborhood is filled with great mansions and modern apartment buildings, many of which are the work of renowned architects. As you walk along its streets, you'll find luxurious properties that range in style from classic to contemporary, each surrounded by thoughtfully maintained gardens that add to the neighborhood an air of sophistication and tranquility.

The grounds are exclusive, most of which are owned by wealthy families, high-end entrepreneurs, celebrities, and political figures. The security is strict, with controlled access, which contributes to the neighborhood's sense of privacy and exclusivity.

The Boedo neighborhood is closely associated with tango development. Traditional bars and cafes have a bohemian atmosphere and many have late night tango shows. Mariano Boedo Square, which has an amphitheater, a children's playground, and towering metal pergolas, is a popular spot during the day. There are often craft fairs on the weekends.
A few blocks away is the Barrio de Parque Patricios, one of the most important green lungs in the Buenos Aires area.
Both neighborhoods offer a variety of restaurants, confectioneries, and beer halls.

neighborhood_overview: The La Recoleta neighborhood is a central residential neighborhood of the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires. This neighborhood is called "the Argentine Paris" because of the great French immigration since 1840 and its consequent architecture. Within its limits are large cultural spaces, historical monuments, the National Museum of Fine Arts, the National Library, the Recoleta Cultural Center and other exhibition pavilions. Recoleta is a thriving area, known for its Paris-style townhouses, opulent former palaces and luxury boutiques. The Recoleta Cemetery is one of the main attractions, as it houses the extravagant tombs of national icons such as Eva PerÃ³n. In the National Museum of Fine Arts, masterpieces are exhibited, while in the Recoleta Cultural Center, avant-garde temporary events are offered. In the lawn-covered Plaza Francia, a handicraft market is held on weekends. It differs from the other neighborhoods of Buenos Aires by the quality of its architecture and the aristocratic cha

neighborhood_overview:
San NicolÃ¡s is a vibrant, energetic neighborhood located in the heart of the City of Buenos Aires. This area is known for its rich history, imposing architecture and lively nightlife.

Walking through its streets is a unique experience, as you can see historic and modern buildings living together in perfect harmony. You will also find a large amount of stores, restaurants and coffee shops where you can enjoy the local cuisine.

One of the neighborhood's main attractions is the iconic Obelisco, a historic landmark in the center of Plaza de la RepÃºblica. From there, you'll have access to some of the city's main tourist attractions, such as the Teatro ColÃ³n, Casa Rosada, and the National Congress.

The area is also known for its nightlife, with a lot of bars, pubs and clubs where you can enjoy music and fun in late hours.

In addition, San NicolÃ¡s is a very well connected neighborhood with a lot of transportation available, including subways and bus

neighborhood_overview: Location can't be beat. It is situated in the heart of the safe and tango tradition Almagro neighborhood,  just a 10-minute drive from Palermo, with plenty to do within walking distance.
host_about:
For the last 4 years we traveled the world. We did it with planes, ships, car, motorbikes, campervans, riding bicycles, lodging in family houses, hotels, hostels and even tents. We met more than 40 countries and countless people. Our objective besides geting to know the beauties, was to experience the reality, philosophy and lifestyle of each country, being able to get involved with their culture and customs.
Today from our hometown, Buenos Aires, we want to continue traveling through the people doing what passionate us: cultural exchange and travel experiences.
Welcome to Argentina!
Learn more about us in our blog for cultural and independent travelers: www.somosgolondrinos.com or in Facebook https://www.facebook.com/pg/face.golondrinos
We enjoy being both, guest and host.
When we are guests we want to learn the cultures to adopt different thoughts and manners. We love history, culture, traditional food and different life philosophy beyond the touristic and common path. When we are hosts, we enjoy cooking and shareing traditional argentinian dishes, taking our guests to nice places, meet our friends and introduce them. We also enjoy being tourists in our hometown along with them.

Welcome to Belgrano, one of the most elegant and exciting neighborhoods in Buenos Aires! Located in the north of the city, Belgrano is a popular destination for local and international travelers looking for a unique experience in Buenos Aires.

This neighborhood offers a wide variety of options for all tastes and budgets. From gourmet restaurants and trendy stores to traditional bars and cafes, here you will find everything you need for an unforgettable stay.

Belgrano is known for its beautiful plazas and parks, where you can relax and enjoy the sun while sipping a mate or reading a book. Parque de la Ciudad and Parque Barrancas de Belgrano are two of the most popular attractions in the neighborhood.

description: Discover the rustic charm of San Telmo, Buenos Aires in our cozy loft. Enjoy a bright living room, fully equipped kitchen, and plush queen-size bed in the cozy upstairs bedroom. neighborhood_overview: San Telmo, a historic neighborhood in Buenos Aires, is known for its old-world charm and vibrant atmosphere. Explore its cobbled streets and discover antique shops, art galleries, and quaint cafes. Visit the iconic San Telmo Market, where you can find local crafts, fresh produce, and lively tango performances. Nearby, you'll find Plaza Dorrego, a charming square surrounded by charming cafes and restaurants, perfect for people-watching. Immerse yourself in the rich cultural heritage of San Telmo and experience the authentic flavor of Buenos Aires.

The Barrio de San Telmo boasts temporary art galleries, night bars and incredible street murals give old San Telmo a bohemian feel. Packed with antique dealers and rustic meat restaurants, Defense Street runs through Dorrego Square, home to a flea market and street performers who attract tourists every Sunday. The neighborhood has many establishments that offer dinners with tango shows.

In Lezama Park there are trails that wind around tall jacaranda trees and the Italian National Historical Museum. Beautiful place to go for a walk and enjoy.

A few blocks away is the LA MOUTH neighborhood that has several restaurants specializing in meats and street performers with tango shows surrounding Caminito, the famous narrow alley flanked by brightly painted zinc houses that evoke the early days of immigrants. neighborhood_overview:
Recoleta is a neighborhood with a lot of history and culture that offers many options for a tourist who wants to explore and discover the best of Buenos Aires. It is known for its elegant architecture, impressive museums, art galleries and antique shops.

The main tourist attraction of the neighborhood is the Recoleta Cemetery, where the tombs of many important personalities of Argentine history are located, such as Eva PerÃ³n and other politicians, writers and artists. It can be a fascinating experience for those interested in history and culture.

In addition to the cemetery, the neighborhood has several renowned museums, such as the National Museum of Fine Arts, the MACBA and the Recoleta Cultural Center. There are also many parks and squares, such as Thays Park and Plaza Francia, where you can relax and enjoy the view.

neighborhood_overview:
The Barrio de San Telmo boasts temporary art galleries, night bars and incredible street murals give old San Telmo a bohemian feel. Packed with antique dealers and rustic meat restaurants, Defense Street runs through Dorrego Square, home to a flea market and street performers who attract tourists every Sunday. The neighborhood has many establishments that offer dinners with tango shows.

In Lezama Park there are trails that wind around tall jacaranda trees and the Italian National Historical Museum. Beautiful place to go for a walk and enjoy.

A few blocks away is the LA MOUTH neighborhood that has several restaurants specializing in meats and street performers with tango shows surrounding Caminito, the famous narrow alley flanked by brightly painted zinc houses that evoke the early days of immigrants. Here is also La Bombonera, which vibrates on match days. It is home to the Boca Juniors football team. You can also find the Proa Foundation Museum of Modern Art whic

name: Hermoso Apart Palermo Hollywood.
description:
Enjoy the simplicity of this quiet, central home in the heart of Palermo Hollywood.
Just minutes from the forests of Palermo, El Rosedal, Paseo de la Infanta, Ecoparque, shopping centers (Alto Palermo, Los Arcos, Solar de la Abadadia, Campo de Polo, Hipodromo and Casino , close to numerous bars and restaurants.
neighborhood_overview:
Palermo Hollywood, a subdistrict of Palermo, gets its name due to the presence of TV studios and film producers in the area. It is also one of the city's favorite places to dine, as it has a variety of restaurants ranging from elegant sushi bars to sophisticated steakhouses. After dinner, a lively nightlife begins. name: Casa con jardÃ­n y parrilla en Villa Devoto
description:
Our house is cozy, very comfortable and spacious. The garden with grill is an oasis to enjoy the umbrella in summer and the heat of the sun in winter.
The dining kitchen is fully equipped and features a breakfast room. The hall, spacious and with a piano, offers a relaxing space both on the sofa next to the window and on the pinote table to share with family or friends.
neighborhood_overview:
Villa Devoto is a quiet neighborhood, safe and green neighborhood. Around Plaza Arenales, which is 500 meters from our house, there is a modern gastronomic pole with restaurants of all kinds (ethnic, vegan, author). The area's ice cream shops offer the best ice cream and the cafes stand out for their good atmosphere. The neighborhood also has two theaters and a ten minute drive away. Shopping Devoto shopping promenade offers movie theaters with premieres to enjoy with friends or family.
Plaza Arenales has two play spaces for children, banks and grass conducive to the recreation of children and adults. In addition, there are itinerant fairs of producers, wine tasting - in 2023 Villa Devoto was established as "Wine District"- and on Tuesdays the municipal food fair is established there: economical and well-stocked.

Las CaÃ±itas' gastronomic offerings are very wide, from typical Argentine food to high quality international food restaurants.

name: Barrio Chino CÃ³modo Apartamento
description:
Enjoy Ciudad de Buenos Aires in this comfortable apartment in the heart of Barrio Chino.
The Chinatown of Buenos Aires is a slice of the Belgrano neighborhood with a markedly oriental identity, which was defined as a result of a wave of retirement during the 1980s in which many Asian immigrant families were established.
neighborhood_overview:
The Chinatown of Buenos Aires is a slice of the Belgrano neighborhood with a markedly oriental identity, which was defined as a result of a wave of immigration during the 1980s in which many Asian immigrant families were established, mainly from Taiwan. These Chinese, Japanese, and Taiwanese families quickly changed the neighborhood's appearance with the opening of numerous Asian, local restaurants to the street, and even one of the city's first Buddhist temples, Chong Kuan Temple, opened in 1988, on MontaÃ±eses Street.

The best thing to recommend for a visit to the Chinatown is to enter through the imposing access archway, located in Juramento and ArribeÃ±os. This way, you'll see on either side of the street the shops and supermarkets with typical oriental products, from imported food to decor items or hose and anime venues (Japanese cartoons and cartoons and cartoons).

neighborhood_overview:
The Chinatown of Buenos Aires is a slice of the Belgrano neighborhood with a markedly oriental identity, which was defined as a result of a wave of immigration during the 1980s in which many Asian immigrant families were established, mainly from Taiwan. These Chinese, Japanese, and Taiwanese families quickly changed the neighborhood's appearance with the opening of numerous Asian, local restaurants to the street, and even one of the city's first Buddhist temples, Chong Kuan Temple, opened in 1988, on MontaÃ±eses Street.

The best thing to recommend for a visit to the Chinatown is to enter through the imposing access archway, located in Juramento and ArribeÃ±os. This way, you'll see on either side of the street the shops and supermarkets with typical oriental products, from imported food to decor items or hose and anime venues (Japanese cartoons and cartoons and cartoons).

There are shops and supermarkets.
100 meters from the house you will find the old San Telmo Market with its large number of bars and gastronomic offer and , antique shops.
On Sundays, and with just leaving the house, on Defense Street, you can visit the San Telmo fair, with thousands of crafts, art, antiques and outdoor tango shows!!,

The years spilled the exclusivity of the area a few blocks beyond its direct area of influence, and today the subarea could be delimited by the Avenida del Libertador and the avenues Luis MarÃ­a Campos, Jorge Newbery and Federico Lacroze.
The area has an incredible cultural offer, new and interesting gourmet options that attract tourists and locals, who come to see what impression this incipient new golden age of the neighborhood leaves them.
The area is close to many playgrounds, such as the Chino Barrio, the HipÃ³dromo with its Casino, the Planetarium, the Palermo Mosque, the Japanese Garden, the River Plate stadium, the La Rural fairground and most important: meters from the largest green lung of the Federal Capital "Los Bosques de Palermo". neighborhood_overview:
Palermo Soho is one of the favorite neighborhoods of locals and tourists, to walk, eat, discover new trends or buy items with an Argentine seal.

In addition to wandering aimlessly, in Palermo Soho you will be able to enjoy excellent gastronomy. Award-winning grills such as Lo de Jesus and La Cabrera (200 meters from the apartment) are internationally recognized for the quality of their meats.

If you prefer pasta we recommend Il Mattarello or La Alacena, the two options near the apartment as well.

Around the department you will be able to enjoy numerous breweries and gourmet burger restaurants that offer unique blends that combine the best Argentine meat with the best local craft beer.

In Palermo Soho, you will not lack options when it comes to breakfast, brunch or a snack on some of its terraces or hidden gardens.

neighborhood_overview:
The NEIGHBORHOOD
This little apartment is located on Calle NuÃ±ez quasi corner with Mariano Acha, next to a beautiful park. The neighborhood (the border between Saavedra and Villa Urquiza) is very quaint and is just that, a typical middle class neighborhood of Capital Federal. Characterized by its typical nearby businesses, the neighborhood has not escaped the opening of new businesses "Cancheros", highlighting pizzerias, bars and cultural centers. As soon as you are received in the apartment, we will leave you a complete listing with all the recommendations to do in the neighborhood. This neighborhood has the charm of combining modern and traditional, with its historic shops around every corner. An authentic experience in the middle of Capital Federal.

In terms of transportation, the apartment is very conveniently located, with numerous lines of colectivos nearby, as well as the underground line B and the Mitre train.

name: Spacious PH in San Telmo
description:
Spacious PH ideal for families located in the Buenos Aires neighborhood of San Telmo. It can accommodate 4 people and is equipped with a full kitchen and bathroom. It has a balcony, grill and laundry.

Its decoration is elegant, contemporary and minimalist.

Located in one of the most picturesque areas of Buenos Aires, with great gastronomic and cultural activity, with easy access to various points of interest and means of transportation.
neighborhood_overview:
San Telmo is one of the oldest and most traditional neighborhoods in Buenos Aires. It is part of the Historic Center of the city and preserves much of its architectural heritage. Its cobbled streets, low houses and patios with cisterns suggest a picture frozen in time. It is also notable for its bars and, especially, for the wide variety of restaurants, tango shops, and antique shops of different types.

In the heart of San Telmo is Plaza Dorrego, the oldest in Buenos Aires after the historic Plaza de Mayo. On Sundays this space is the scene of the most important open-air antiques fair in the city. Pedro GonzÃ¡lez Telmo, Patron of the Navigators, was a friar of the Dominican order who lived in Spain in the 13th century. neighborhood_overview:
What's in Palermo Soho?

Design and Decoration

Palermo Soho has become a center of design and decoration within the City.

Restaurants

Palermo Soho is one of the main catronomic poles of Buenos Aires. There are grills, Italian, French, Mexican, sushi, Arabic, Jewish, Brazilian, Peruvian, Thai, Vietnamese, vegetarian, celiac and everything you can think of.

Fashion

More than 300 clothing and accessories stores from both independent designers and major brands.

In Palermo Soho there is a circuit of art galleries, which usually participate in events such as Gallery Days and Gallery Nights.

Theatres and Entertainment Rooms

Several independent rooms make Palermo Soho an alternative in terms of theater. There are also several bars and venues where you can listen to live music, such as Sheldon Bar, Virasoro, Borges 1975, Quetzal, La Paila, Foynes, Manchester Pub and others.

host_about:
Hello. Im Francisco _x000D_
I am a Lawyer and Realtor, but nowadays I am involved in many other things, such as property maintenance and development, Agro, and taking holidays myself in Airbnb properties elsewhere._x000D_
I live out in the country 2 hours from Buenos Aires, surrounded by the Pampas, nature and horses. _x000D_
As a City of Buenos Aires guide myself, I have a passion about the warp and weft of my town and relish the chance to share this enthusiasm with my guests._x000D_
I'm fond of books and the flat in Buenos Aires is well- filled with them. _x000D_
I enjoy traveling especially to Uruguay, music, art and the cultural opportunities presented by their design. I also winter in Patagonia where I go Skiing, sport I love.  _x000D_
My properties are always ready for visitors. I like to keep it clean and uncluttered, such as you would expect in a good hotel â€“ it is home I like to share with you if you stay. I can't always be there but I will make sure everything goes smoothly. _x000D_
The motto -Carpe Diemâ€“ Seize the moment while you can_x000D_
Drives my life !
