host_about:
Hello. Im Francisco _x000D_
I am a Lawyer and Realtor, but nowadays I am involved in many other things, such as property maintenance and development, Agro, and taking holidays myself in Airbnb properties elsewhere._x000D_
I live out in the country 2 hours from Buenos Aires, surrounded by the Pampas, nature and horses. _x000D_
As a City of Buenos Aires guide myself, I have a passion about the warp and weft of my town and relish the chance to share this enthusiasm with my guests._x000D_
I'm fond of books and the flat in Buenos Aires is well- filled with them. _x000D_
I enjoy traveling especially to Uruguay, music, art and the cultural opportunities presented by their design. I also winter in Patagonia where I go Skiing, sport I love.  _x000D_
My properties are always ready for visitors. I like to keep it clean and uncluttered, such as you would expect in a good hotel â€“ it is home I like to share with you if you stay. I can't always be there but I will make sure everything goes smoothly. _x000D_
The motto -Carpe Diemâ€“ Seize the moment while you can_x000D_
Drives my life !

name: Espectacular piso con Piscina en Recoleta
description:
The apartment is a complete apartment, located in a modern building with amenities, in one of the most important areas of the city of Buenos Aires. It is equipped for a comfortable stay.
Close to large shopping center, main gastronomic sites, as well as squares, parks and main avenues, which can be reached quickly by walking.
It has easy and direct access to all the means of transport that connect the city.
neighborhood_overview:
Colloquially called Barrio Norte, but officially named Recoleta, it has as its main attraction an important shopping center with the best brands in the country.
Its streets run through places out of a European postcard. Example of this can be the beautiful passage Bollini, where the house where the famous writer Jorge Luis Borges lived, or the passage Anasagasti, a picturesque street with Parisian airs.
El Barrio has easy access to the main avenues. These connect to the city's most important attractions.
Such is how walking along Libertador Avenue to the north you can easily reach Parque Tres de Febrero (Bosques de Palermo) or to the south with the Retiro district, where you can find picturesque buildings such as the Kavanagh.
The Barrio is close to the main art museums of the city, as are the case of the Malba and the Museum of Fine Arts of Buenos Aires.
Also to other important shopping centers, such as "Patio Bullrich" or "Paseo Alcorta", where you can fi

Area of rich restaurants, bars and green squares to enjoy walks in the area.

Nestled within this area is the iconic Florida pedestrian street, bustling with shops, cafes, and street performers, creating a lively atmosphere for visitors to enjoy leisurely strolls. Nearby, the historic GalerÃ­as PacÃ­fico shopping center stands as a landmark destination, housing upscale boutiques and hosting art exhibitions within its stunning architecture.

Venturing into the surrounding streets, one can explore Arroyo Street, known for its plethora of art galleries showcasing a diverse range of artistic expressions. A stroll along this picturesque avenue offers a glimpse into Buenos Aires' rich artistic heritage.

Adding to the allure of the neighborhood are the shops lining Avenida Santa Fe, among which the Grand Ateneo bookshop stands out as a beloved institution for book enthusiasts. With its vast collection and inviting ambiance,

Saavedra is a residential neighborhood, very well connected and safe.

The apartment is located 300 meters from "Parque Saavedra", one of the most beautiful in the City. In addition, you are also very close to "Parque Sarmiento" and the "Donado" green corridor.

PUBLIC TRANSPORT
You have many options!
- TRAIN. The "Saavedra" station of the "Mitre" train is located just 400 meters from the apartment and connects you with the main neighborhoods of the city: Belgrano R, Colegiales, Palermo, Recoleta and Retiro and, in the other direction, takes you to the Olivos neighborhood and the "Costa Train" (which you can take to go for a walk to Tigre neighborhood).

- BUS. You have many bus options that run 24 hours a day from Monday to Sunday (with different frequencies) and connect you with the entire city. The main lines are: 67, 29, 19, 76.

Our charming studio is located in a vibrant and convenient neighborhood in Buenos Aires. Right in front of the building, you'll find a Carrefour Express supermarket for your daily needs, along with a 24-hour maxi kiosk on the corner. In addition, the area is replete with restaurants that offer a wide variety of dining options for all tastes.

This neighborhood is known for being a hotel area, which guarantees a solid infrastructure and a vibrant city life. In addition, its central location gives you easy access to various points of interest. Just 50 meters away, you will find the metrobus stop 9 de Julio, facilitating your trips around the city.

Within walking distance, you can reach the iconic Obelisk and the famous Avenida Corrientes, known for its nightlife and theatres. You will also be close to the elegant Santa Fe Avenue, the historic Plaza San MartÃ­n and the bustling Retiro district.

For shopping lovers, shopping Galerias Pacifico and Patio Bullri

host_about:
Hello. Im Francisco _x000D_
I am a Lawyer and Realtor, but nowadays I am involved in many other things, such as property maintenance and development, Agro, and taking holidays myself in Airbnb properties elsewhere._x000D_
I live out in the country 2 hours from Buenos Aires, surrounded by the Pampas, nature and horses. _x000D_
As a City of Buenos Aires guide myself, I have a passion about the warp and weft of my town and relish the chance to share this enthusiasm with my guests._x000D_
I'm fond of books and the flat in Buenos Aires is well- filled with them. _x000D_
I enjoy traveling especially to Uruguay, music, art and the cultural opportunities presented by their design. I also winter in Patagonia where I go Skiing, sport I love.  _x000D_
My properties are always ready for visitors. I like to keep it clean and uncluttered, such as you would expect in a good hotel â€“ it is home I like to share with you if you stay. I can't always be there but I will make sure everything goes smoothly. _x000D_
The motto -Carpe Diemâ€“ Seize the moment while you can_x000D_
Drives my life !

Hello. Im Francisco _x000D_

I live out in the country 2 hours from Buenos Aires, surrounded by the Pampas, nature and horses. _x000D_

I'm fond of books and the flat in Buenos Aires is well- filled with them. _x000D_
I enjoy traveling especially to Uruguay, music, art and the cultural opportunities presented by their design. I also winter in Patagonia where I go Skiing, sport I love.  _x000D_
My properties are always ready for visitors. I like to keep it clean and uncluttered, such as you would expect in a good hotel â€“ it is home I like to share with you if you stay. I can't always be there but I will make sure everything goes smoothly. _x000D_

Drives my life !

neighborhood_overview:
Belgrano is a historic and traditional neighborhood of Buenos Aires, located to the north of the city. The history of human occupation in the area dates back to pre-Columbian times, when it was inhabited by original communities. During the colonial era, the area began to develop, mainly as rural areas and later as part of the growth of Buenos Aires to the north.

In the late 19th century, Belgrano acquired political importance, as it was temporarily the capital of Argentina in 1880 during the crisis between Buenos Aires and the federal government. With the construction of the train and urban expansion, it was consolidated as an upper and upper-middle class neighborhood.

An important factor in its development was the Vega stream, a watercourse that used to cross the area. Although today it is piped, it was key in the agricultural and livestock expansion of the region, and later in the urban layout, allowing the neighborhood infrastructure to grow around its channel.

Hola! Hace quince aÃ±os que vivo aquÃ­ luego de muchos aÃ±os de viajes y de vida en Europa. Vivi y estudiÃ© en Italia. Soy sociÃ³loga de formaciÃ³n, escritora y profesora de Yoga MÃ©todo Iyengar, Ceriticada en 2022. 
Adoro este lugar que fui armando a lo largo del tiempo. La biblioteca cuenta de mis intereses y de mis viajes. Las migraciones italianas, la inmigraciÃ³n italiana en Argentina y la alimentaciÃ³n como cultura e historia son algunos de mis mayores intereses, asÃ­ como el vino y la cocina del MediterrÃ¡neo. TambiÃ©n amo todo lo relacionado con el hilado y el tejido del lino que vuela en mis ventanas y subre mis colchones. La prÃ¡ctica del yoga ha sido fundamental para poner mis pies en la tierra, para sentirme vital y seguir disfrutando de la vida. TambiÃ©n tengo una huella fundamental. Mi estadÃ­a en Italia en un Hotel de campo me cambiÃ³ la vida.
